lines.text: Now the nightmare is all over, ladies. The next man who lays a finger on any of you will be... your husband.
Well this is unbelieveable!
Here touch me, it's true.
I'm full of interest - right now!
You know what's the matter with him, don't ya?
What?
He's in love.
Oh!
Do you know a longer way to the governor's office, Captain?
Yes, through the woods, kinda pretty.
So you like me as a nightingale? Wasn't I magnificent?
Oh, you're a modest little fellow, aren't you?
I'm known as the mad Mudlark of the Mississippi. Ssh, don't tell a soul.
No, I won't. I'll leave that for you to do.
I fight only for pay, not for my life.
Ah, oh well that's too bad.
See the lovely flowers Captain Warrington bought me. Lovely aren't they?
Squeeze the juice out of them things and it's mighty good when you get a boil on your neck.
Good for swollen feet too.
Poor Don Carlos, suffered such excruciating misery from seasickness, almost at the despair of his life.
But he didn't die?
Fortunately not.
Sad.
Oh, that's Warrington.
My men will take care of him.
Well, who's going to take care of your men?
Now let's talk this over as one mudlark to another...
I do not wish to be included in that.
...but that was no street singers' warbling, Blue Eyes. The quality of those tones was something...
I used to appear at the Opera Comique.
I see, until the manager wished for you to appear as Lady Godiva and you refused.
Yes, something like that, yes.

[after rescuing the Casquette girls]
Alright, boys. Turn away and grit your teeth; that's contraband.
I thought your world didn't include women.
Oh, I wish it was full of them and they all looked like you.
